data.title: Click2Houston.com
data.meta_description: Visit Houston Life for the latest lifestyle news in Houston, Texas, from NBC TV's local affiliate, KPRC - Houston's Channel 2.
data.text:
In two days, Lucas will celebrate his thirteenth birthday and for most of his birthdays, he has had the same big wish...to get an up-close look at an Airbus A380 - the world’s largest passenger airliner.

M-K-T & Houston Plant Market are teaming up to host our 2nd annual White Linen Night! The event is free and open to the public. Celebrating local art from New Orleans, White Linen Night has become a staple in The Heights. Dress up in your favorite white attire as you parade the SITE WIDE market featuring local vendors selling all types of plants, jewelry, candles, lotions, and art.

Houston Life and Shell Federal Credit Union are teaming up once again to show some special teachers some love as they head back to the classroom.

Houstonian Christine Foster has always been an active mom. She's an avid kickboxer, runs half marathons, and maintains a healthy diet. But as she went through Menopause she was told that her brain fog, weight gain and hot flashes were just something she'd have to life with. After starting Semaglutide and Bioidentical hormone replacement therapy with the Antiage Institute, Christine says she finally feels like herself again. Watch the full interview to learn more.

Internationally renowned pastor Jerry Eze arrived in Houston on Thursday, July 25. In town from Nigeria, the lead pastor of Streams of Joy International will once again lead the NSPPD America Prayer Conference. Last year tens of thousands of worshipers crowded into the George R Brown Convention Center for the prayer conference. Pastor Eze took time out ahead of the conference to show Houston life’s Melanie Camp behind the scenes as his team prepares for this year’s event.

At Core Chiropractic doctors Natalie and Phillip Cordova and their team of chiropractors, tailor patients’ treatment plans by combining adjustments with other cutting-edge therapies. Learn how something called PEMF is helping their patients find relief from pain.

Two local theaters teamed up to bring the musical version of "The Color Purple" on stage. Find out how to see the performance this August.

If you are looking to take the next step in following your dreams Lone Star College can help. Providing high quality, affordable education for students, Lone Star College is focused on helping you along your path to success.

Charles Blake from Humble, T.X. is on a health journey that incorporates a non-invasive weight loss solution that uses laser technology. Blake's journey is just beginning but he says he has already lost almost 17 pounds in just three weeks, and he credits the team at Innovative Lasers of Houston for helping him succeed.

Nearly a year after devastating wildfires destroyed parts of Maui, including the entire town of Lahaina, the attitudes about travel have now shifted and become more optimistic. Travelzoo Senior Editor Gabe Saglie chats with Houston Life hosts Derrick Shore and Tessa Barrera about what's happening outside the burn zone and explains how travel numbers are still so low that now might be a great time to make that trip across the Pacific.

We're taking you inside the factory of Houston-based Living Designs Furniture where their team of designers will work with you to create the furniture pieces you've always wanted. Designer Sarah Zubowski shows us how she took a popular sectional design and transformed it to create a high-end designer look.

She's a local Air Force veteran with an out-of-this-world life. Sharon Caples McDougle used to suit up astronauts before they went to space. Now, she's sharing her inspiring story. We caught up with her to see what she has been up to since her last visit to Houston Life.

There are a lot of internet providers available to us here in Houston but how do you know you are signed up to the right one and getting the best deal? HighSpeedInternet.com provides a way for you to search a better deal on the most reliable internet connection available to you and helps you compare your options.

Local author Leah Cast talks about growing your faith with her latest book, "Transplant." It's a 30-week devotional aimed at inspiring and encouraging readers. She also just received two major national and international book awards. We heard all about the honors plus balancing her life as an author, model, and entrepreneur in our chat with her.

If you are tired of trying fad diets that do not work, then you might want to take a look at this innovative weight loss technology at Innovative Lasers of Houston that aims to help you lose weight with the help of lasers.

Whether you're considering buying, selling, or renovating a home, timing can be everything. Real estate expert Lily Jang shares the latest on the Houston housing market and offers advice for getting your home prepared for the next major weather event.

It's hard to believe, but we're already less than a month away from the start of the new school year. Now's the time to get your kids on track with those doctor check-ups and appointments - including a trip to the dentist.

The #1 musical in the world has continues to wow audiences since its premiere in 1997 – and now is your chance to see Disney’s The Lion King live on stage!

Phyllis Sikes spent years dreading those visits because of an autoimmune disease that affects her oral health. Sikes was researching a more permanent solution when she came across Dr. Michel Azer and the team at Texas Dental Implant Center.

Kalahari Resorts & Conventions in Round Rock, Texas founded National Waterpark Day back in 2017. To celebrate, they're offering some great discounts and deals for the whole family to cool off this summer.

If you've been dealing with joint or nerve pain, even the simplest daily activities can become painstakingly difficult. Instead of medication and surgery, doctors at NexGenEsis use the patient's own biologics to put the body in the best position to heal itself. Watch the full interview to learn more about their therapy options that they say can help their clients live happier, healthier lives.

On Houston Life, we're talking squash. Not the vegetable, the sport! It is played in nearly 200 countries and we highlighted the Junior World Squash Championships that's happening in Houston for the first time. The CEO of the Houston Squash Club stopped by with some talented players so we could learn more about this intense and strategic sport.

Create a positive impact of gratitude on National Give Something Away Day. Local non-profit Bread of Life is accepting donations for their back-to-school drive and hurricane relief. Find out how you can be part of this meaningful cause.

The Solar Flare Music Festival is the newest music event to add to your calendar!15 acts with their own unique style and stage presence will perform next month. We got a preview of Marley Moon, you can experience her smooth vocals and nostalgic sounds at the festival. Continue watching to find out all the details and where you can go to stay on top of Houston's indie music scene.

Local influencer Jasmine Nguyen has joined NBC Universal’s Paris Creative Collective – a group of engaging creators who will have unprecedented access to tell stories of the games through their own eyes. Check out Jasmine's interview with Houston Life's Derrick Shore and KPRC 2 news anchor Daniella Guzman.

Derrick Shore and Daniella Guzman sat down with country artist Rick Trevino. They talked about his decades-long career, what he's been up to, and a special live performance of his new single "The Ride" -- a heartfelt autobiographical account that talks about the highs and lows of life and all the benefits if you just hang on for the ride.

When the going gets tough, the Relief Gang get going. The brainchild of rapper Trey the Truth. This is a way that Houston neighbors can help each other out in times of need.

Watch as we help Daniella Guzman get ready for the Olympics with a fun game you can play at home with the family!

Embark on a shopping adventure at "The Hive: A Pop Up Collective"! You can mingle with the amazing and talented women behind the unique finds. Hear their amazing stories and see how they cheer each other on as they journey towards success.

On July 10th at NRG Arena, 3,360 people from 121 countries were sworn in as new U.S. citizens. It was Houston's largest-ever naturalization ceremony and took place despite the massive heatwave and power outages affecting the region after Hurricane Beryl.

Celebrate 713 Day with some brews! For The Culture Brewing stopped by with their latest lager that is perfect for summertime. They've collaborated with an Atlanta-based lifestyle brand for beer lovers. Watch the video above to see how you can get in on the fun and support the city's only black-owned brewery.

For the first time in 20 years, the Texas FFA Association will call Houston home for their annual state convention at the George R. Brown Convention Center.

How to spot scammers taking advantage after a natural disaster. All the tips and advice on keeping your family safe. Plus, how to create a conversation with your kids fearful of storms.
